template.template: Template SNMP APC SmartUPS - Jim Cronqvist
template.name: Template SNMP APC SmartUPS - Jim Cronqvist

item.name: UPS battery capacity (%)
item.description: The remaining percentage of battery charge. The Monitor will return a result of 100% if the battery is fully charged and running on line voltage.

item.name: UPS battery status
item.description:
The status of the UPS batteries:
1 = Unknown 2 = Battery Normal 3 = Battery Low
Note: The enumeration 'Battery Low' (3) indicates that the UPS will be unable to sustain the current load, and its services will be lost if power is not restored.
Monitoring Condition: Pass if equal to 2
Monitor failure indicates that the battery status is either 'Unknown' (communication with the UPS has been lost) or that the battery is running low and will turn off shortly. This is used as a final warning condition.

item.name: UPS output frequency
item.description: The current output frequency of the UPS system in Hz.

item.name: UPS output load (%)
item.description: The current UPS load expressed in percent of rated capacity.

item.name: UPS output voltage
item.description: The output voltage of the UPS system in VAC.

item.name: UPS replace battery indicator
item.description:
Indicates whether the UPS batteries need to be replaced:
1 = Batteries do not need replacing 2 = Batteries need replacing
Monitoring Condition: Pass if not equal to 2
Monitor failure indicates that there is a UPS battery that needs to be changed. The UPS may not perform as desired should a power failure occur.

item.name: UPS status
item.description:
** Value map: apcStatus **
1 => unknown 2 => onLine 3 => onBattery 4 => onSmartBoost 5 => timedSleeping 6 => softwareBypass 7 => off 8 => rebooting 9 => switchedBypass 10 => hardwareFailureBypass 11 => sleepingUntilPowerReturn 12 => onSmartTrim
The current state of the UPS:
Monitoring Condition: Pass if equal to 2
Monitor failure indicates that the UPS is not supplying line voltage to any attached devices.

item.name: UPS time on battery
item.description:
The elapsed time since the UPS has switched to battery power. This value is reported in 100ths of a second.
Monitoring Condition: Pass if less than 12000.
Monitor failure indicates that the UPS has been supplying battery power to attached devices for longer than 2 minutes.

trigger.name: UPS - On battery for more than 5 min ({ITEM.LASTVALUE})
trigger.description: On battery for more than 5 min.

trigger.name: UPS - Remaining battery capacity is less than 25% ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} left)
UPS - Remaining battery capacity is less than 50% ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} left)

dependency.name: UPS - Remaining battery capacity is less than 25% ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} left)

trigger.name: UPS - Remaining battery capacity is less than 75% ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} left)

dependency.name: UPS - Remaining battery capacity is less than 50% ({ITEM.LASTVALUE} left)

trigger.name: UPS Run time remaining CRITICAL (< 15 min)
UPS Run time remaining LOW (< 30 min)

dependency.name: UPS Run time remaining CRITICAL (< 15 min)
